description:
Seriously this is the only place in the neighborhood where you can get a sandwich for under $10!  The food is good like all the Andersen Bakeries.  I also like to pick up a pastry sometimes after my Starbucks run across the building.  

Service is very matter of fact but they get things done.  The staff will not fawn over you or make chit chat.  That's fine because I just want a sandwich!
author: Wendy H.

description:
I went here for lunch with a friend. We went at 1pm on a Monday, so there was a bit of a wait, but they seemed to be able to keep the line moving really well. they have a bunch of delicious-looking pastries in the front, and I was very tempted to get one. 

The menu was a bit confusing, since the paper one was different than the one they had on the board, but it seemed that we could order from either one. 

I ordered the eggplant sandwich on whole wheat bread, which ended up being $8. The sandwich was delicious! The ingredients seemed really fresh, and the bread was really well toasted. I wish they had been a bit more clear about whether or not the inside of the sandwich would be hot, since I had assumed it would be, but then it was just room temperature. 

My friend ordered the BBQ chicken sandwich, which she said was really good as well! 

Overall, I really liked the food, but I felt like the interior wasn't that great.  There are three tables, and one small bar where four people can sit. The tables were slightly dirty, and the people working there were too busy to clean. I'd recommend getting your food to go, then eating it at the Civic Center park nearby.
author: Amara C.

description: Super busy spot on Market. They are fast and have good options.
author: Sunil R.

description:
Good Yet not worth the $9.xx price tag. 
An interview brought me into San Francisco, specifically the Civic Center area. Was looking for nice, quick, and cheap bite before my interview. The atmosphere is very calm and customer service is fine. I would not come again for a second bite due to the price tag. However, if I was a working here and they provided a buy five sandwiches, get your 6th one free that would definitely incentive me.
author: Dulce-Maria M.

description:
Let's talk about why I got sick for 1.5 weeks and how it relates to Anderson bakery.... 

it was flu season end of 2017, last week of December to be more precise... I was but a lone wolf seeking sustenance on a quick lunch break in civic center. Having found great sandwiches at Anderson bakery in the past I decided to go in, I paid attention to a number of coughs-sneezes I heard from behind the counter while waiting for my food, I thanked them for my meal, heard cashier say to chef 'your going home early'.... nothing clicked at the time but soon after I come down with a nasty flu, I'm talking about headache, stomach ache, can barely keep water down, fever, chills add in some freakish cold symptoms like a cough and sneezes.... sick like a dog for 1.5 weeks exactly, not call in sick and Netflix chill sick, sick like hanging on to life contemplating this journey of life while having fever dreams SICK.... 

I make a recovery, this muts back in the races ... lunch rolls around and head into Anderson... I see that chef in the back, tell me why she is talking to another employee saying how she got 'food poisoning' and was out for 5 days, couldn't eat anything had fever and chills-- BAM it all clicks for me like a bad cerebral sci-fi movie ..... naw homie food poising isn't contagious and you spread that like the pesto on my chicken sandwich!!

Now let's examine the REAL issue here .... why did this employee of a food prep company feel the need to come into work while feeling sick... I would like Anderson to pay employees more or possibly give more sick time to avoid situations like that. To be fair, maybe it was just a bad employee who abuses these things already given by Anderson? Idk I never worked there to know.

My review is 2 Stars, would have got maaaaybe 4 had I not contracted the dog flu (what I'm calling it) from their chef
author: John O.

description:
The food at Andersen is always good. But today I wanted to give them a shout out for the very good customer service I experienced. 

I order a strawberry cake for my staff and I needed it at 6:30AM. I was instructed to order online and the earliest pickup option was 9AM. I added a special instruction to pick up at 6:30AM. I called customer service day before to double check that they read my note and would accommodate my request. I have no trust in customer service these days! To my surprise they were familiar with my order and had already made the arrangement for me. 

The cake was ready early and delicious as always. Thank you Andersen Bakery at Fox Plaza!
author: Anika L.

description: They do wonderful breads and pastries. They are large decent portions without bieng too pricey but we are in SF. I love their breakfast sandwiches and the staff is very courteous.
author: Jay B.

description: The chicken salad sandwich on whole wheat is amazing.  I order it without sprouts.  So fresh.
author: J L.

description:
NO ONE speaks/understands plain, simple English in this operation.  And even easy instructions given in fluent Spanish (which I speak; I'm a Cuban-American) are a #fail for them.  

What the hell is so difficult to understand about "I'd like a chicken salad on toasted sourdough, please -- no sprouts and light mayo only"?  And when English is obviously a challenge (that becomes quickly apparent, depending on the clerk), and I order in Spanish instead ("Por favor, quisiera una ensalada de pollo con pan de sourdough tostado, sin soya y con un poquito de mayonesa solamente")  How can things go wrong...right?  But nope...in the Shitty-By-The-Bay, anything's possible, including complete illiteracy.

So what did I get back today?  Instead of my chicken salad, it was tuna salad on plain white (not toasted), with sprouts.
Last time it was the chicken salad, not toasted, heavy mayo.
And the time before that, chicken salad, barely toasted, heavy sprouts.

And truth be told, I call the little blond Mexican gal in the back -- this Andersen's "chef" -- the chief culprit of translation #fail.  And the clerks at the registers are also basically comprehension-challenged, if admittedly very nice kids.

But for a $9.25 for a run-of-the-mill sandwich, "nice" isn't enough -- I want it done right.  It *cannot* be THAT hard.

Anyhow, today was Strike Three.  Now they're OUT.  I guess it's time to walk the extra few blocks to Ted's (or God forbid, that horror-movie Subway on Van Ness) if I want a quick takeout sandwich.
author: Gabe K.

description:
They make their English muffins in-house and their samples are da bomb! Finally decided to check out this neighborhood place after constantly smelling their bread on my morning walks with my pups. This place didn't have stellar reviews, but they definitely work for me! 

Service is pretty fast, and selection is relatively good (for a bread place). The bread I got from here was good as well and lasted a long time. But that scrambled egg with cheese and tomato hits the spot for me!

It's good to know I can still get a good deal on a breakfast sandwich in the area without breaking the bank.

Likes:
-samples galore
-homemade English muffins!
-fast service
-relatively inexpensive

Dislikes:
-baked goods are addicting (but this is a good problem to have)
author: Tracy T.

description:
Just grabbed breakfast here. The space is really cute and the perfect place to get a quick sandwich or pastry. I've lived down the block for a year so I figured as I move to a new neighborhood, I might as well finally try this place. After all, I'm not at risk to get addicted to a bakery if I'm 2 miles away, right?

I ordered a tomato, egg and cheese on an English muffin and a large coffee. With tax, this came out to $7 which seems more than fair. They got my order together quickly and within 5 minutes I was chowing on my sandwich. Some things to know about me: I'm from New England where making a good breakfast sandwich is an art so as a result, I'm pretty picky about them. The one from Andersen was....meh. My main gripe is the kind of cheese used. It seemed like it was American cheese which is a big no-no. The egg was one of those weird scramble patties which is disappointing. They did give a nice slice of tomato and the English muffin it was on was definitely homemade and delicious. The coffee was fine and cheap, especially compared to the Starbucks across the plaza.

This place definitely has regulars which adds to an interesting vibe. During my visit they seemed to know on a first-name basis everyone who came in which was nice. Their customer service seemed to also be great. A woman mentioned to one of the employees that her breakfast sandwich was burnt and they offered to make her a new one but she declined. They brought her out a free pastry anyway to make up for it. I thought it was very thoughtful and sweet.

Overall, it was fine. I wish I had gotten a pastry but eh, healthy eating. If you're in the area before anything else is open (they open at 6), it's worth a stop but if you have other options (like La Boulangerie de SF or Corridor Cafe), go to those
author: Carrie W.

description: It was great. Friendly service and an awesome breakfast sandwich.  What better way to start the day!
author: Brandon D.

description: I love Andersen's truly I do but the tuna salad sandwich they just served me is what we like to say, "outta pocket!". However I do consider maybe the pocket that I requested was a little long hence the spread of thinness. I'm not doing much meat nowadays yet I did want some tuna and had I truly wanted more I would have asked what the issue was but I considered things. I could have gotten the bottom of the bowl tuna that was made for today, like I said the slice pain de campane) is long as all get out so these things have to be considered. All is all sandwich was ok and next time I'll go with a diff opinion. It also doesn't help how the strawberry and cream cheese pastry I was given was the smaller of the two and I have a issue with ppl who don't notice these subtleties yet maybe he rather sale the largest one 1/2 2moro or eat it himself, not sure. Service is always good and ingredients always fresh. I'll try again another day.
author: domenique c.

description:
Good for breakfast, nice selections of baked goods and average prices. 
Love the blueberry danish, light flakey danish with the blueberries not to overly sweet. You can taste more of the blueberries and not the sugar glaze.
Wished they served hot coco
author: M I.

description: Conveniently located in Fox Plaza building across from Starbucks and the PostOffice quick 2 block walk up Market from my apartment at 33 8th Street. Reasonable delicious fresh bakery bread and pastries.  They make hugh sandwiches! Loved my raisin apple bread and garlic butter French bread! Soft bread not hard as a rock like other bread I got across the street. The bread doesn't break a tooth if toasted lol.
author: Patricia H.

description: This review is on the customer service of this lady (filipino or samoan??). I find her disrespectful and rude to certain customers such as me. I've been there several times as it is close to where I work. I feel this filipino lady has bias on certain customers. She is much more friendly on the repeated customers who wear suits. Today I felt disrespected by her service. I was waiting patiently in line as she was impatiently and giving an attitude training the new staff who was trying to learn. They were serving a customer in front of me. Then later that filipino lady assisted this guy right away who came in minutes after me and was not even in line. She served him and took his payment as I was still patiently waiting in line. I could tell he was a repeated customer by their interactions. She was really friendly to him. But when it came my turn, she greeted me with a dark, unfriendly face. She has always been horrible. Anyways, I will not go back anymore because she is very disrespectful to certain customers and only choose customers she likes to be friendly with. I like Andersen Bakery's bread, but this would be the branch I would not go to again because of horrible customer service time and time again by this filipino lady. If she leaves Andersen for good, I'll definitely go back! Also, the bread is not completely fresh because I saw them take out the bread I ordered from the fridge at the front and heat them up for me....
author: Kat K.

description: I love Anderson Bakery! This location is not one of my favorites though. Staff at the register was not friendly, the store was not very clean. In over all I did not feel welcome as a customer. I will not go back to this location. I love Anderson food, tuna salad sandwich is my to go as well as chicken salad sandwich. I will keep looking for other locations! I am a fan of you Anderson but this location sorry sucks !
author: Mayra R.

description: I am a creature of habit and nothing brings me greater lunch pleasure than the delicious reliability of ordering my Veggie Feast sandwich or Tomato Raviolini soup online and having it waiting for me at Andersen's. The bread the sandwiches are made on is tasty and fresh (I recommend the country sour whole wheat), the soup is hot, the prices are reasonable and the service is friendly and consistent. Sometimes the line gets long or the small space gets hectic during the lunch hour, which is why I recommend ordering through their website and picking up in store so you can be in and out. Any time there has been an issue with my order, the staff at Andersen's has promptly helped me out as well. Lots of veggie sandwich options also!!
author: Emily M.

description:
Good lunch spot in the UN Plaza area. 

A couple blocks south - by fox plaza. Most of the time a brisk walk. It's like a wind tunnel to get there.

I love getting their tomato soup. It comes with a side of sourdough bread. It's super yum and filing. 

I've had their sandwiches too- they are good, but they don't do half sandwiches. Get that if you're super hungry. 

Cookies/cakes/pastries - all of them are good.
author: Muneera M.

description:
Slim picking in the neighborhood... like really slim. And Anderson's delivers. The people that work there are really nice too.

I typically stick to the breakfast sandwich (request no butter cause they add additional butter which is just way too much), or the tuna melt on a sesame bagel.
author: Nolan M.

description:
_Walked in and loved the simple and clean look

_Employee informed they were out of quite a bit of options. 

_ Ended up ordering the turkey and mozzarella and I'm pretty disappointed. The bread is great, but the sandwich is dull, no extra perks (chips, salad, etc). 

_They don't have a stationed music station, instead have the radio playing with tons of advertisement breaks.

_water cups are way too small, why?
author: Herald A.

description:
STALE bread at a "bakery". How Ironic. 

P.S. - If you're going to make a sandwich with old bread, please don't charge $8: http://bit.ly/11RjRSG. Do you know how much someone can get for $8 in the nearby TL? It will probably come with a side of STDs but just saying...
author: Cherylynn N.

description:
Eh! I paid $8.50 for the chopped Cobb salad and it wasn't chopped and it didn't come with all the usual toppings like eggs for instance. I won't be returning here for a salad at least. I hate wasting money.

Update- as I'm eating the salad I taste that they out goat cheese and not blue cheese. Yuck!!!!! I am taking away another star.
author: Brittney D.

description: A-OK spot to get a sandwich and pastry. I especially enjoy their chicken salad sandwiches and fruit pastries. The chicken sandwich, though chilled, has good mayo and purple onion flavor. Pastry has the perfect level of flakiness, and the sugar glaze is nice. Price is reasonable. I dont enjoy their coffee though. This Andersens has places to sit.
author: Thomas L.

description: do NOT buy your lunch here.  Most pathetic excuse for a sandwich i've ever seen.
author: Ray M.

description:
I patronize this establishment often... At least twice a month. My favorite items are:

1. The turkey and avocado sandwich on sourdough bread. The bread is always fresh and the sandwich is pretty tasty, especially when you add the basil and pesto mayo. Yummmm!

2. The oat nut chocolate cookie is phenomenal! It's a chocolate chip cookie married to a oatmeal cookie, and union is bomb! This is a must-try!

3. The international cheese bread is force to be reckoned with. I've never had anything like it. At one point, they stopped selling it, but then brought it back (I'm guess by popular demand).

Anyway, it's a good place for decent food. Oh, and can't forget about the friendly staff! Thanks guys!
author: Sylvia O.

description:
I love this place. It's got great food, good service, nice seating, it's clean, and they give you a lot of food for the price.

The chicken salad sandwich is my favorite so far, but I like everything I've had so far. Apparently some people have randomly had bad experiences there, but I've always been happy. Not a lot of other decent food in the area, so this place is my go-to a lot of the time.
author: Sarah K.

description:
I love bread; LOVE it.  i also love a good sandwich.  Andersen Bakery provides both.  I've eaten here three times and tried different sandwiches each time.  The California BLT is my favorite, but roast beef is delicious too. 

Once you open the door you're almost immediately on top of the register.  Be prepared to order because otherwise it becomes a cluster in front of the door.  While the restaurant is small there are spots inside to sit and eat.  Though I've always taken it to go.
author: Michelle C.

description: The sandwiches here are AMAZING!!! Staff are friendly, did i mention how yummy the sandwiches are? :) GET THE CHICKEN SALAD on SOFT FRENCH BUN or SOURDOUGH! i promise you, you're gonna love it!
author: Cindy C.

description: Their chocolate cakes are delish! Never go into this bakery unless you are prepared to gain some weight! I tried their chocolate cake twice and both times everyone enjoyed it so much. Went at noon to pick out the cake and the one I got was the last one they had left at that time. Luckily I wanted a chocolate cake but just in case, I would go earlier for better selections
author: Elena K.

description: Standard sandwich place. Good service.  Love the chicken avocado on soft french bread.
author: Ju D.

description: Stay away at all costs. Their pre packaged salads looked like they were prepared in 1995. Chicken  looks so disgustingly manufactured and inedible, lettuce leaves are yellowing and wilting, and the Parmesan cheese smelled so abnormally foul. Sadly I received food poisoning from their Caesar salad. I won't be returning ever.
author: Denise M.

description: I must admit I was not a fan of this place in the beginning, but the employees have been very nice to me since. The service isn't bad and the coffee is good enough for me to enjoy. The pastries aren't too bad either!
author: Chris R.

description: Located in the Fox Plaza, Andersen is very convenient for a quick sandwich bite, good snack options and delicious sweets.  I love the pesto bread, sliced and toasted, OH MY GOSH- to die for!  Overall, I love this place when I have absolutely no idea where to go for lunch.
author: Katie N.

description:
Walked in a little bit before lunch. The sweet employee was helpful in assist in me to choose a snack.

She gave me some good suggestions and gave me some samples.

It's dangerous for my hips.

I would return to try some more items. 
Other employees were bland, but the one who helped me was sweet.

Their location is pretty clean.
author: Rhema F.

description:
I had oh so many misgivings about this place before I even walked in.  It looked too corporate.  It looked too spartan.  It was filled with corporate Spartans, or spartan corporates.  They wouldn't have anything vegetarian.  People were blocking the line rather than standing in it.  People were blocking the door.

But you know what?  My sandwich was good, and it was made to order with what tasted like fresh ingredients.  While the bread was good but not bakery good, the cheese was cheese-store good.

The people who work here are very friendly, and they keep the line a-moving, which I'm sure is essential around lunch hour.

Still a little pricy for what I got, but I wouldn't mind coming back either if I got stuck on a month-long civil-trial jury again.
author: John S.

description:
No, no...no

Actually eating the tiniest, most awkwardly packaged, soggy sandwich of my life right now.
author: Paisley P.

description:
Anderson, I've been dreading writing this review and have tried to avoid it for many months as there are things I really do like about you!

The fact is, out of the last 6 times I have ordered food from you, my ordered has been messed up 4 of the times. Twice I have ordered bagel with cream cheese, tomato and ham and have gotten bagel with JUST cream cheese instead. One time I ordered a chicken salad sandwich and instead got turkey avocado. Today I ordered a BBQ chicken sandwich and you forgot the BBQ sauce! The other two times my order was correct, and free (both were in response to me calling to complain about orders that were incorrect).

I called you today and will be getting yet another free sandwich out of this fiasco. While I do enjoy eating my sandwiches at 50% off, I don't enjoy the 30 min wasted walking there and waiting for my $7.50 sandwich, only to return to my desk and open it up and see that it is not what I ordered. Not how I like to spend my only 30 minutes of free time during the day.

Please update your training methods because I can only imagine that many more sandwich mishaps are going unreported because most people do not enjoy spending the remaining 15 minutes of their lunch break calling you to complain and then posting on Yelp immediately after.

You have so much potential as a lunch spot but you really need to step up your game, especially with Twitter and Square coming into the neighborhood...
author: Ariel M.

description:
Staffs here deserves a 5stars. I stop by here every morning before going to work to buy some goodies/bread and a coffee (as an alternative cafe brand of my choice), they would always great you with a smile especially the cashier guy which I wasn't able to get his name. But I know we know each other by face. 

So another FIVE STAR for you Cahier Guy!
author: Mei Y.

description: I've purchased their cranberry walnut bread and it's been 5 star consistently. Its 6 dollars a loaf, but well worth it.
author: Rob J.

description:
omg THANK YOU FOR BEING HERE. The mornings where I don't have enough time to get REAL coffee (Thank you MUNI!) and I wind up at Starbucks are already  bad enough... Then I face the cruel reality of their shiteous pastries uGH.

THANK YOU FOR BEING HERE NOW! I can have ACTUAL pastries that don't taste cold and stale.
author: Susy C.

description:
Purchased the bbq chicken sandwich for almost $9. The chicken did not have a nice grilled appearance. Looked and felt as if it was under heated. The look was not pleasing to the eye.
May have been the cook because I have had it a few times before but this time it just wasn't it and for almost $9.00 quality should be better.
author: Pamela T.

description:
Usually I go here for my go-to sandwich when I can't think of anything else to eat. I had leftovers of their Chicken Salad sandwich and decided not to eat them until the next day.

Lo and behold...there's a twist tie in my sandwich. A TWIST TIE!! Those twist ties that are used to tie the openings of the bread bags.

What if I had swallowed that thing? It a metal wire...that would've been so dangerous. I am shocked that Andersen Bakery would be so careless.

I am completely disgusted and turned-off. NEVER again.

(See photo I have uploaded)
author: Michelle K.

description:
Not worth a trip from anywhere else... but if you happen to be in the area it's a fine option.

Fresh baked bread, available in both full and half loaves. The sourdough is quite good. The raisin loaf is decent. Several sandwiches to choose from, some good, some just ok.

There gets to be a pretty decent line here at times, and the space to line up is tiny. So inevitably people are coming in from Fox Plaza and in from the street and all converging in front of the counter like a Tokyo train station. You may need to stab someone to keep your place in line. So bring a knife.

On your way out, be sure to say hello to the homeless people gathered on the street. Some of them have interesting stories about lost loves, wildebeests, and alien anal probes.

Three stars.
author: TJ P.

description: I like this place in the morning because there's almost never a line, the sausage breakfast sandwich on focacia is always toasty, and the coffee is good. It's an escape from the hustle and bustle of the streets where I can chill before starting my day. My only issue is that the cookies are far from amazing. Otherwise, thank Andersen Bakery!
author: Jim E.

description:
What do you do when you want a wine + cheese party but none of the wine bars are open yet? Have your own, of course.

To do so, one needs bread. And on a rainy day walking around in the tenderloin there might not be a hundred thousand options. So you can imagine how super stoked I was to stumble upon Andersen's.

The fig and pecan loaf is fantastic. Sweet and nutty without being overbearing. Love it with a nice oozy cheese like Camembert. 

The half loaf option rocks, and prices are very reasonable ($2-3 for a good sized half loaf).
author: Monica C.

description:
I come here after each dentist visit just so I can stick some cheese and doughy sugars back into my teeth.  I mean, it's right outside the building and when they have a fresh bake, it's impossible to walk away from.  Having pastries or savory baked bread makes a great morning.  

However, the last few times I've come here, they've been having cold savory stuff that they end up heating back up, but its just not the same.  My go to favorite is the Pesto bread with melted cheese inside.
author: Vincent K.

description:
Located in the Fox Plaza Apartments, this is my go-to spot for breakfast and their ice-tea.  It is much better than Starbucks since the lines are not as long.  Pastries are standard price $2.40+ depending on what you get.  The line to order and pay can be a bit confusing since the counter area is small.

Ice tea is not watered down.  Prices recently went up from $1.60 to $1.80.  Ironically their ice machine broke so they will have someone deliver ice to them. So far I've been striking out on Mondays.  ICE ICE BABY!
author: Elliot Y.

description: The cobb salads are fantastic and just the right amount of everything. The line can be intense during lunch because there's not much space to line up- and you end up standing close to diners enjoying their meal. Gets a little awkward that way, however once you've placed your order the food comes up pretty quick and you can dash off!
author: Christina M.

description: I love their breads and pastries. Having this location nearby is so dangerous because its easy to pop in before work and grab a cheese danish. Now I want one.
author: Theresa D.

description: Great customer service.  Sandwiches are delicious.  Turkey avocado on wheat is my favorite
author: Mokrane C.

description: Love the staff. They are always friendly and attentive. However I just went there ten minutes ago for a simple bagel and cream cheese. I haven't been to Anderson's for a bagel in months and I wanted to give them a chance. I didn't check the bagel till I got back to work. Open it up to find my bagel is not only flat like a pancake but it's burnt! I could only eat the top of it and had to throw the rest away. I feel like I just threw away $2. Pretty disappointed and will not be going back. You want good bagels? Go to lunch geek down the street they know how to make a bagel with cream cheese worth your time and money.
author: Shani B.

description:
I actually work across the street from this bakery. It is conveniently located for people who work in the area (and there are many of us) to pick up a quite bite. They have a good selection of pastry and snack. They also provide a pretty decent sit-in area where one can pick up a coffee and work from there. 

Why 3 stars? Well, none of the item on the menu makes me fee like "I must come back to Andersen for it". Some people complain they are over-priced but this I won't complain; it is in downtown San Francisco so what can we complain about? Nonetheless, I really do not find anything special about it that "I must go over to Andersen for", other than that it's conveniently located right across from my office. Hence, 3 stars from me.
author: Victor K.

description: Went to the Civic Center location (in Fox Plaza) to grab a quick sandwich for lunch.  California BLT was calling my name so that was the order, to go.  Opened it up when I got back to the office and it's some soggy, eggplant, mozzarella sandwich.  Now I'm out $7.50, pissed and hungry with no time to get anything else but vending machine cuisine!  YUMMY...thanks guys!!  Was my first and LAST time giving Anderson Bakery my money!  If you do go...check your order before you leave.
author: Brian L.

description: This is a very small and clean establishment that offers a meal on Market Street for under $10 even with tax. Service is usually pretty friendly and no-nonsense. Pickles are also self-served and free, hence I cannot deny this place 5 stars.
author: Albert H.

description: I got the tomato caprese and avocado sandwich. While it was tasty, I was a little annoyed with how it was put together -- ingredients were a bit haphazardly arranged on my baguette. For the price, I think it should be a bit more neat, with ingredients more evenly distributed. I picked up the same sandwich for my dad and he loved it, but then again he was really hungry and pretty much loves anything when he's that hungry. There's a long line around lunch time and you'll have to wait probably 10 minutes (or more) to get your sandwich.
author: Vanessa G.

description:
I ate a sandwich (Turkey Pepperjack) and drank a coke. It was a good combination. I enjoyed the sandwich the waitress pointed to me. Its natural and very light.
Other interesting feature of this restaurant is care of waiter/waitress. The place is very nice too.
I indicate this bakery for all who enjoy healthy foods and for those who use wi-fi this bakery has.
Enjoy is this bakery.
author: João D.

description:
Double your pleasure.

Classic commercial: http://youtu.be/9XJJwAZgAA0

Classic cookie: Double chocolate from Andersen Bakery.

Former has no flavor. Latter is full of flavor.

Latter also doesn't have cheesy commercials that will live forever on YouTube.

They were too busy making awesome cookies.
author: Jason B.

description:
We needed breakfast for the morning of the Bay to Breakers race.  The night before we came to Anderson to get the goods, and they were good!

Pesto croissant
Cheese croissant
cheese danish
muffins

All were excellent heated up that morning and fueled us for a great race past many strange and wonder sights along the race.
author: Paula D.

description: Pretty decent breakfast sandwiches. They make a warm egg, ham and cheese on foccacia bread which turns out to be super yummy! And for lunch, the tuna salad sandwich was pretty decent too. The key is the fresh bread and good ingredients.  Definitely a quality deli.
author: Pancakes D.

description:
RUN, don't walk if you're Mid Market and looking for a fresh, great, sandwich. It's very hard to get just a good sandwich in this city (deli's and such). Service was fast, pleasant, and my Turkey/Avocado was just really really good.

If it's a choice between Andersen and The Griddle a block away, hands down, Andersen.
author: Mark M.

description: I used to go to Grain D'Or at the mall with my mom when I was a little girl. I remember eating the strawberry danish there. It was heavenly. When I found out that Andersen Bakery had them, I had go when I was in town. I bought about six to go. I was a little nervous that maybe I'd hyped them up in my head for 22 years and they wouldn't be as good, but they were just as heavenly. The service could have been crappy or the bakery filthy for all I cared (it was friendly and the place was clean), as long as the danish was good.
author: Mel L.

description: Honestly, I feel they should stick to baking bread. The items used for sandwiches and salads aren't fresh. The meat especially reminds me of cafeteria type food. If i return it would only be cause there are no salad places by my place of work.
author: Nneka G.

description: I love this bakery.  Their cranberry walnut bread is delicious; their cream cheese walnut pastry is amazing, etc!  But, today they did something special with lovely little chocolate heart cakes covered in chocolate ganache!  Yum!
author: Norah M.

description:
Honestly Anderson, you have some major competition with Lunch Geek up the street, Ted's a few blocks south and Deliboard on my speed dial.

But I do appreciate that what I read about my sandwich on your menu is what I get. And not some special, kooky hipster-foodie sandwich mashup (as you can tell, I have been deceived by a list of impressive sounding ingredients). No thanks, I will stick to my franchise-y Turkey/Avo/Swiss sandwich when I'm having a supremely awful and the only thing that will fix it is a walk to your bakery door, no line leading out of it and no wait to get exactly what I want.

Service has always been cool and the sandwich size is pretty decent for what you get (you're paying at least the same if you go anywhere else). I'm not proud of coming here with other local, non-chains to support in the area, but I appreciate what I get (plus the sourdough is the best here).
author: liz c.

description: I had the caprese sandwich for lunch today and it was amazing! It's under the vegetarian choices and is served warm. With this sandwich downstairs in my office I am going to have to write it into my budget because it just became my new favorite sandwich. The oil and mozzarella and basil and avocado were all perfect and satisfying.
author: A P.

description: This is a convenient place for lunch near my office.  I usually just order the BBQ Chicken, which is a big enough sandwich for more than just lunch.  Comes with a big slice of chicken, bacon, sauce, and cabbage.  And when I'm in the mood, I'll also get the Creme Brulee, which is delicious.
author: Karen L.

description: Hey. Smaller than the andersen's I'm use to but it still tastes just like the andersen's I'm use to! Thank goodness cause I really fancy the sandwiches here. Put sprouts on all the sandwiches ok? Ok. Good.
author: Margaret S.

description: This is one of my favorite places to go for a sandwich at lunch.  The interior is clean and always has open seating.  The ham and cheese sandwich is among the best.   If you tell them your order is to stay, they will serve everything on china, including hot beverages.  I like that too.
author: Harry P.

description:
Living right next door I'm so happy that Anderson Bakery moved in.   They are super friendly here and the prices are very reasonable.  Their baked goods are delicious(such a tease!).  My bf and I especially like their spicy turkey sandwich and I really enjoy their fruit salad(which is lettuce, fresh fruit, pecans and a light vinaigrette)  it also comes with two slices of bread(I recommend requesting it be the raisin bread-delicious!)

If you get something to go make sure you check everything is in the bag(I've had a couple slip ups)
author: Kat D.

description:
Been waiting for this place to open for a couple of months now, finally! Being so close to where I work is a definite plus also. 

I ordered the bbq chicken sandwich. It was pretty tasty and flavorful.The sandwich consisted of chicken, bacon, bbq sauce, cabbage, and chipotle mustard all on a toasted ciabatta. One small gripe would be that the bacon could have been slightly crispier. 

Overall the place is great though. I've heard that their are some issues with the staff being new and somewhat slow, but I didn't have any problems. I only had to wait about 5 min. or less to get my order. The place was on the empty side though. This will probably turn into one of my regular spots for lunch.
author: Ajay K.

description:
I've pretty much tried everything on their lunch menu except the vegetarian sandwiches.  My favorites include the chicken salad sandwich, fruit salad & the onion and cheese bagel with cream cheese.  

Two sandwiches that I"m not too fond of is the Chicken Pesto and the Grilled Ham & Cheese.  The chicken breast is deli meat with a thick mayo slapped on.  You'll barely taste the pesto mixed in.  The grilled ham and cheese isn't really grilled, rather heated.  My cheese wasn't even melted.  

Since Anderson's is conveniently located across the street from my office, it's still the healthiest option around.  Love the bread choices.  Be sure to come early because they run out of items by the early afternoon at times.
author: Stacey L.

description: A very small place, the seating fits about 15 people total. The place is clean but customers need to go to Starbucks to use their restroom.
author: M C.

description:
Sweet! Here's to another business to throw into my weekly mix of Martha's Bros Coffee, Cafico and Starbucks runs at work!

I decided to stop by during my afternoon break after two of my coworkers went and grabbed lunch here. They both enjoyed what they had, so I took it as a good sign. And they brought back a take-out menu for our convenience too.

I wanted something small and not so sweet, so I ordered a bowl of their Boston clam chowder. It was definitely delicious and tasty, and I'm thankful that I have a consistent place to go for clam chowder (Cafico only carries clam chowder on Fridays). They provided bread to go with the clam chowder as well, but I think my only complaint was how small the "bowl" was ($4.50 for a tiny bowl that really almost looked like a cup). My coworker ordered a bowl of their clam chowder during lunch, and he said that he was served much more than what I had.

I had to take them down a notch for service because, even though I was the only person there ordering my soup at that time, it took over 5 minutes just to get my food. I think they forgot about me at one point... bummer. I think if they could, they should borrow an employee or two from their neighbor Starbucks because they have AMAZING employeeds who are great with customer service and are very efficient... then again, I don't know how they could work that out...

Next time, I'll go back and try their sweet desserts. They did look great displayed - I just wasn't in the mood for anything really sweet.

Also, if pastries and desserts and soup aren't your thing, they have salads and various kinds of sandwiches available to order.
author: Melissa D.

description: I was in the mood for a Caesar salad with grilled chicken and it was on their menu. So, when it showed up at my table, the chicken looked like it was either raw or boiled. I was disgusted and left my entire plate untouched with a note to their chef. Ugh, what a terrible looking meal. I went hungry and just grabbed a coffee instead. I hope someone else got to eat that rubber chicken, but more than likely it was just tossed in the circular file for the rats in the back.
author: N G.

description:
I work nearby and this place had a sign up for a long time.  And the wait is finally over.  Food is pretty good.  Had the Spicy Turkey Pepperjack and Clam Chowder.  Got my favorite, which is probably many people's favorite..creamy french bread!

Downside?... the service is pretty horrible right now.. but I won't shut it down yet.  It is a pretty new place, they were short a lot of their food and felt really unorganized.

BUT I will be back!
author: Kevin N.

description:
The bread rocks my world and the other sandwich innards are good and fresh, but I don't like the deli style turkey and chicken "loafs."  I'm also not a big fan of the chicken in the chicken noodle soup (kind of the meat equivalent of "cheese food.")  Am going to try one of the hot sandwiches next time.

The sweets look crazy good and luckily I've been able to resist. . . at least for now.  I'm thankful for a quick easy option in the 'hood, though.  I also like the counter staff.  I've only been there twice and they remembered me.
author: Ms. C.

description:
Sandwiched between two other chain bakeries (Boudin & La Boulangerie), Andersen Bakery on Market street was my stop for a sandwich since Boudin's had a line and I didn't discover La Boulangerie until after my unfortunate lunch. 

The chicken salad sandwich was overloaded with mayonnaise which overpowered any other flavor in the salad. When I opened it up to look at it I found a measly spoonful slapped in the center of 2 large pieces of white bread, a handful of sprouts, and lettuce. There was way too much empty bread space to consider this a $7 sandwich. 

As for the pastries, there wasn't much to choose from. And what was presented was presented poorly, on empty trays scattered about. I wasn't sold on trying one because I had no idea how long they'd been sitting there.

With the competition so close in one block, you've got to step it up Andersen's! I doubt I'll be back. Peaceful service alone is not going to save you.
author: Foodie F.

description: Friendly staff and a good selection of breakfast-type breads, both sweet and savory. Grab a cheese danish or ham & cheese croissant to go with your coffee. Better prices than expected for this kind of thing balances the neighborhood. The onion-cheddar bagel was far more sweet onion than cheddar, and I've found that their bagels are much lighter and fluffier than most, more like an English muffin than the dense bagel I expect. That may be good for some people, but as ex-girlfriends have occasionally mentioned, I can sometimes seem more on the dense side. ;)
author: Bill B.

description:
I was not so happy this most recent visit for the following reason:
I noticeed a counter person that handles food sneeze rather violently into her hands - two or three times.  So I observed her for a few minutes and although she seemed to hesitate momentarily, and look around, she NEVER WASHED HER HANDS.  She simply kept handling food and giving it to customers.  GLAD it was not my food, but aren't there some rules?  Shouldn't it be a sensible idea to WASH YOUR HANDS after you sneeze all over them.  With this flu season being so bad why doesn't a FOOD WORKER know enough to be CLEAN? 

Yuck, I don't know if I can ever go back here after seeing that.  It makes me wonder what goes on that I don't see the rest of the time.
author: Em J.

description:
Nice addition to the neighborhood. 

I noticed that another Andersen location had a way better looking chicken caesar salad -- generous amounts of parmesan, freshly chopped parsley was sprinkled on top, and it wasn't soggy.  They put the chicken on top when it's piping hot and close the lid, which steams it up a bit.   You get bread of the day with your salad.  I'm still hitting up this spot regularly.

Haven't had their sandwiches but just the bread is pretty damn good.
author: Erika C.

description:
Hope I don't get fat on their bagels and cream cheese.  

Bagel is so soft.
author: David L.

description: The cream cheese walnut bread thing is fantastic! Its rustic and flavorful and not full of sugar. Also, this is the cheapest bagel and cream cheese you'll find in the area ($1.64 or so).
author: Cori W.

description: Really good bread, good sandwiches, and nice people. However, not great when it comes to special requests. Literally half the time my "no tomatoes" request goes unfulfilled, as does my "add turkey" request, which is a bigger deal b/c of the extra charge. Obviously not a huge deal, but it is slightly annoying. I walk a bit further to Ted's if I really want to make sure I get the sandwich that I order. Get it together, Andersens! As Sweet Brown might say, "aint nobody got time for the wrong sandwich!"
author: Mark B.

description: Please don't go here .. There were flies on their pastries and the pastries tasted stale.
author: Yash R.

description:
I've made frequent trips to this Andersen Bakery in the last two weeks, usually for snacks but once for lunch.

The first time I came in about 3 PM and most of the bread/pastries were sold out by that time so I got a creamy french. The bread was nice and crunchy. I got a hot turkey pepperjack for lunch during the busy lunch hour this week and the tiny store got VERY crowded. The sandwich, nevertheless, was delicious - although I swear I get more avocado in my sandwich when I order at other Anderesens. 

In short, Andersen is a great place to get fresh pastries and yummy sandwiches on a large variety of bread. Be warned, their stock of baked goods seems to diminish rapidly after the lunch rush so it's best to hit the store early if there's something you're specifically looking for. Each time I've come here the staff has been very friendly and welcoming.
author: Monica W.

description: Good food decent selection there not up to par as there others on market. I do enjoy the BBQ sandwich and most of the day it's super quiet.
author: Josh A.

description: Unlike some other locations for the Andersen's Bakery chain,  the staff get's their Almond Croissants mostly right!  Right enough to visit more than once when I have my choice of other place to go while performing some professional services work nearby.  Good job guys!
author: Chris R.

description:
I stopped in for a bagel + cream cheese on my way to the airport.  After the trek to SFO and the ordeal that was security, I was so disappointed to take out my bagel and find it practically burned beyond recognition.  

I uploaded a photo just in case you think I am too picky about the extent of the toastedness of a bagel.   

I even gave them another chance a few weeks later and the 2nd bagel STILL came back charred (although slightly less charred than the 1st one).

Go half a block down Market Street to Little Griddle.  I've had two bagels there and both have been toasted to perfection.
author: C L.

description: After countless attempts to get a good lunch at Andersen, I am saying good riddens to their food.  Their food is hit or miss and is overpriced. The end.
author: Monica S.

description:
$7 sandwiches that aren't good and skimps on loading it up, totally not worth it.
Average cost of croissants, $2.40.
Nothing to rave about. I don't know what people come here for.
author: Keiko C.

description:
LOVE seeing this in the area, fresh baked bread daily! You cannot go wrong!

The prices represent the quality, and I really love the decor, though the staff could be a little nicer (grumble grumble).

I prefer their onion cheddar bagel, their sourdough bread, and their apple bread. I haven't really had any of their pastries, sandwiches or desserts, but I keep seeing a sign for a bacon bun?! Everytime I go in, it's already gone - next time, for sure!
author: Natalie S.

description:
Two stars seems a bit mean, but according to Yelp it represents "Meh....I've had better," which is my sentiment when it comes to this establishment. I generally only come here when I don't pack a lunch, since it is at the bottom of my building. Their pastry and bread products are OK - the cookies and the baguettes are stale though. I generally stick with the spicy turkey sandwich. It's definitely better than subway. My biggest complaint is that the sometimes it seems like they are just being really cheap with what they give you. I bought a salad once and the lettuce was slimy from going bad. Another time I bought soup and there was barely any in the container. I bought a bagel with cream cheese and it seemed like they warmed it up in the microwave since it was squishy and chewy with no crunch! (You're a bakery, buy a toaster!!). Tonight, I got a sandwich, which they usually serve with a pickle and bread, and I didn't even get a napkin. 

I'm sure I'll be going back though, since I'm too lazy to leave the building.
author: Meg W.

description: I just had the best cold sandwich I've ever tasted. I got the mozzarella turkey on sourdough, and all the ingredients were fresh and delicious. The pickle spear was even exceptional. I'll definitely be back.
author: Leila A.

description: I usually like Anderson's for their bagels, but never again will I have a sandwich. I ordered a turkey and avocado sandwich. It was drowned in Dijon mustard and had exactly one slice of avocado for THE ENTIRE SANDWICH. I basically bit into Dijon mustard and bread. It was disgusting. Beware ordering a sandwich.
author: Chelsea N.

description: I was so happy to see a new place open in this building, but when I found out it was Andersen Bread I was super excited. I love their Saffron Twists and their hot sandwiches are pretty good too. I have yet to try their deserts, but they sell pretty quickly from what I can tell, so they must be good. The staff is super friendly and they are starting to recognize me, since I go in so often for a twist.
author: Tyler D.

description: The food is fine, and this has always been a go-to place for us in SF. But this time when we went there a horrible manager (the one with the German sounding accent) ruined it for us and the poor young woman who works with her. The young woman told the manager to switch our coffee orders, and when the manger forgot, the young woman told us we either had to pay the difference, or she would have the money taken out of her pay. When we tried to give her a tip to make up for the mess, the manager snatched the money out of her hand right in front of us. Crazy! And not exactly the way to make a place feel welcoming. Did I mention this was on Xmas eve? One star for the oppressed worker. :(
author: Merrily W.

description: Decent place to grab a croissant and some coffee in the morning. Friendly service and pretty quick. Seems like a morning commuter stop to me :)
author: Greg G.

description: Cute place for lunch. Love their chicken and avocado sandwich on foccacia bread- their bread is so soft. I also like to pair this with their fruit salad- love the toasted walnuts. Only downfall is they don't have wi-fi.
author: Sheena S.

description: Their sandwiches are delicious!  So far I've tried their mozzarella and eggplant and caprese.  I've also tried their black sesame bagel with cream cheese.  Everything has been tasty, the service is fast and friendly and prices are very reasonable.  I intend to keep going back and sampling some more goodies; their creme brulee looks particularly tasty!
author: Marika A.

description: Nice little place. Super convenient, and probably the least sketchy place to eat nearby. I had the chicken noodle soup, which was a lot of soup and not so much chicken or noodle, but the whole thing was only $5, so I can't really complain.
author: Grant M.

description: I come to Anderson Bakery at least twice a week. Turkey, Swiss & Avocado & tuna are my favorites...the staff is ALWAYS friendly... thank you Andersen for making my top 5 lunch destinations!!
author: Steen H.

description:
This place is new to the area, and I'm a fan, though I've only had their sour dough bread, EVERY type of bagel they offer, and (of course) the coffee. 

The bread is pretty good, but I'M BIG FAN of their bagels - I often go in and buy whatever bagels they have left, the onion cheddar is just to die for and goes very well inplace of a bun for a cheeseburger or sandwhich. The prices are fair enough considering the quality of what you get - apparently, they make ALL their bread fresh every morning - it's local too, I think the bakery is in east bay somewhere. 

Also, thank GOD for this location, there really isn't much else in the area besides starbucks (boo!). They serve Peerless coffee, which is okay, but I wish they served something a little better tasting. The staff is friendly enough, but I wish they were a little nicer/happier/more interesting to talk to.
author: Basil B.

description: Went there yesterday morning thinking I would get better coffee than at the Starbucks next door and asked if they have iced coffee I ordered one after getting a positive answer to witness the girl with who I was interacting planning to pour some burning hot coffee on top of some ice cubes. Told her it wasn't what I was expecting and that I didn't want it then she stopped talking to me. So if you want watered down warm coffee served with an awful attitude go there.
author: fabrice a.

description: My family and I were visiting San Fransisco and looking for a good place to eat. All the locals were suggesting chains when we wanted a small little breakfast place. Then we stumbled upon this place! Had a cheap excellent breakfast with pastry and bread galore! You local people should really be supporting this place!
author: Andrew S.

description: i'm going to have to take 2 stars away.  i hate it when places get your order wrong!  i ordered a turkey & mozzarella sandwich and the receipt is correct but the order is wrong!  they gave me a turkey & avacado instead!  VERY DISAPPOINTING!!!  and of course it's not worth it for me to walk back to exchange it...but i shouldn't have to even do that since they should've looked at the ticket more closely.  pay attention people!
author: Vic S.

description: Great place to order cakes. This is the first time I chose a delivery option from this location. Mya at this location was very helpful and the Chocolate Ganache Cake was delivered on time and was great . Highly Recommend this place.
author: G A.

description: good service. she was nice staff... I really recommend if you are looking for bakes or a light lunch , they offer a large menu of sandwich included vegan too. ... and you have to see the cakes!!! are great !
author: B H.

description: I went to the Fox Plaza Andersen's Bakery.  It looked clean inside and the food display caught my attention, quite an assortment of breads and pastries.  I ordered a 6" birthday cake for my 1 year old granddaughter - the chocolate dream cake with whipped cream frosting.  My granddaughter thought it was tasty.  She ate some, had it on her hair and face, just having a good old time with it.  The cake was moist, light and not too sweet.  Definitely liked the whipped cream frosting.  I also bought a 9 grain bagel, it was ok.  I'll be returning to try other things.
author: mitzi s.

description: Went in today with high hopes for a new place to get a quick lunch. Ordered the Soup and Cesar salad with Chicken. Soup was ok, nothing special and the salad consisted of lettuce and ground cheese, real I hope, and chicken. Glad I asked for dressing or they would have forgetten. They didn't give me a fork either. Now some of this stuff is understandable in a new restaurant, but a salad with only lettuce and cheese?? Give me a break. I will not be going back.
author: Scott M.
